theresa.goal: Identify my available 1-hour slots on Monday between 9:00 and 17:00.

charles.goal: Identify my available 1-hour slots on Monday between 9:00 and 17:00.

betty.goal: Identify my available 1-hour slots on Monday between 9:00 and 17:00.

orchestrator.goal: Find the earliest 1-hour slot on Monday between 9:00 and 17:00 that is free for all participants, and define the final schedule.

public_information: The scheduling window is Monday, 9:00 to 17:00.
The required meeting duration is 1 hour (60 minutes).
Participants are Theresa, Charles, and Betty.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in modeling time constraints using PDDL. You must define a PDDL domain and problem that represents your unavailable time slots and identifies potential 1-hour available intervals between 9:00 and 17:00.

You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL integration and temporal consistency auditing. Your primary role is to integrate conflicting or overlapping temporal constraints from multiple agents and resolve the planning problem. You must ensure the final solution respects all scheduling constraints and meets the global goal. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeting the FastDownwards solver.
